alert.note: Alert for Elbert, Central and East Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 12 at 3:44PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...Thunderstorms and possible landspouts will impact portions of eastern Douglas and west central Elbert Counties through 430 PM MDT... At 342 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking developing thunderstorms capable of producing a landspout tornado along a line extending from near The Pinery to 6 miles west of Elbert, or along a line extending from 20 miles southeast of Denver to 24 miles north of Colorado Springs. Movement was northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts possible. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Landspout tornadoes can damage mobile homes, roofs, vehicles, and trees. Outdoor objects may be tossed about. Locations impacted include... Southern Parker, Elbert, Elizabeth, Ponderosa Park, The Pinery and Franktown. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. If a tornado is spotted seek shelter inside a sturdy building.

area.areaDesc: Elbert, Central and East Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet
